about_the_game:
Annie and the Art Gallery is a short, free horror RPG that aims to capture the feel from classic RPGMaker horror games. You play as Annie, a girl who's finally got a ticket to the new art exhibit. When she gets there, however, she's dragged into a bizarre conflict that takes her through the museum's haunted basement. Help Annie solve puzzles, figure out who to trust, and find out the truth of what happened there years before.

Some random and possibly cool features:

  • Unique hand-drawn art style.
  • Save at any time.
  • Ghost girl(s).
  • Animated cutscenes.
  • Traps, sudden deaths, and chase sequences.
  • Multiple difficulty options.
  • A non-silent protagonist in an RPGMaker horror game.
  • Maybe a plot twist.

Note from the developer:

Thank you for playing my game! I am a solo developer based in the New England region, and it really means a lot that you've read this far! Annie and the Art Gallery is a love letter to classic RPGMaker horror hits such as Witch’s House and Ib. Inspiration was also drawn from more contemporary RPGMaker hits such as Oneshot and Omori.

content_descriptors.notes: This game contains depictions of depression, anxiety, and suicide. Also contains strong language and depictions of blood.

name: Annie and the Art Gallery

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: why arent you using windows 10
  • Processor: Star QCS-1 350-C Toaster
  • Graphics: literally anything
  • Sound Card: apple airpods pro max plus ($1299)
  • Additional Notes: Batteries Sold Seperately. While Supplies Last.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i3-4340 / AMD FX-4330 or better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Dedicated GPU, OpenGL support, 1GB VRAM
  • DirectX: Version 9.0c
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Can run on macOS Sonoma via GPTK or Parallels.

short_description: After months of waiting, Annie finally snags a ticket to the new art exhibit. However, things take a turn for the worst: she finds herself trapped in the museum's haunted basement. Help her navigate puzzles, traps, and more as she tries to escape - and find out the truth of what's really going on.
supported_languages:
English*, Spanish - Spain*, Spanish - Latin America*
*languages with full audio support
